intro: Oxypolis canbyi, commonly known as Canby's cow-plant, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, white to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, round fruits that are dispersed by wind, and it is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Oxypolis canbyi is a perennial herb that thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant.
